article.title: Finding counterparts for All-sky X-ray surveys with Nway: a Bayesian algorithm for cross-matching multiple catalogues

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the positional uncertainties for X-ray sources in the 2RXS (left) and XMMSL2 (right) surveys. What trend is observed between the X-ray flux and positional uncertainty?
choices: As X-ray flux increases, positional uncertainty decreases.
As X-ray flux increases, positional uncertainty increases.
There is no clear relationship between X-ray flux and positional uncertainty.
Positional uncertainty remains constant across all X-ray fluxes.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure displays the flux distribution for three different X-ray surveys: 2RXS, XMMSL2, and 3XMM-DR5. Which of these surveys probes the deepest (i.e., detects the faintest sources)?
choices: All surveys have the same depth.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure depicts the AllWISE color-magnitude distribution of counterparts to the 3XMM-DR5 catalogue, compared to the distribution of all AllWISE sources within 2 arcminutes of the 3XMM-DR5 sources. What does this figure suggest about using AllWISE color-magnitude information as a prior for identifying counterparts?
choices: The distinct separation between 3XMM-DR5 counterparts and the field population suggests it is an effective prior.
The overlap between the two populations indicates AllWISE color-magnitude information is not a useful prior.
AllWISE color-magnitude information is only useful for identifying very bright counterparts.
This figure does not provide any information about using AllWISE data as a prior.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the probability (p_any) that the right counterpart is among the AllWISE sources for 2RXS and XMMSL2. Which statement is TRUE based on the bottom panel?
choices: The fraction of expected interlopers decreases with increasing p_any, meaning higher p_any corresponds to a more reliable counterpart.
The fraction of expected interlopers is independent of p_any.
Higher detection likelihood always results in lower fraction of interlopers.
A p_any of 0.5 guarantees no chance association.
